quiz.question: What is the primary difference between Free-to-Play and Premium game models?
options: Free-to-Play games are always free and donâ€™t generate any revenue.
Premium games charge players upfront and do not offer additional purchases.
Free-to-Play games generate revenue through in-game purchases and ads.
Premium games offer a subscription-based revenue model.
quiz.hint: Consider how each model generates revenue.

quiz.question: Which of the following is a common method for monetizing Free-to-Play games?
options: Charging an upfront fee before playing.
Offering a single purchase for all future updates.
Implementing in-game advertisements and microtransactions.
Requiring a monthly subscription to access the game.
quiz.hint: Think about ways Free-to-Play games might encourage spending without an initial cost.

quiz.question: What is a potential downside of using a subscription model for game monetization?
options: Lower initial user acquisition compared to Free-to-Play.
Inability to offer any additional purchases.
No way to integrate advertisements.
No consistent revenue stream.
quiz.hint: Consider how the requirement for ongoing payments might affect new users.

quiz.question: How do in-game purchases typically function in Free-to-Play games?
options: They are mandatory for game progression.
They offer players optional enhancements or cosmetic items.
They replace the need for advertisements.
They are the same as subscription fees.
quiz.hint: Think about what players get in exchange for in-game purchases.

quiz.question: What is a common method of ad integration in mobile games?
options: Playing ads only at the beginning of the game.
Offering rewards for watching ads voluntarily.
Interrupting gameplay every few seconds with ads.
Requiring an ad to be watched before starting the game.
quiz.hint: Consider how ads can be used without disrupting the user experience too much.
